newsitem.title: CHINA: China's Jilin Chemical fights pollution.
newsitem.headline: China's Jilin Chemical fights pollution.

text.p: Jilin Chemical Industrial Co Ltd has completed expansion of a waste water treatment plant on Songhua River in northeast China at a cost 305 million yuan ($36.7 million), the Financial News said on Thursday.
Jilin Chemical's waste water treatment plant on the river that runs through the provinces of Jilin and Heilongjiang began operation recently after 15 months of construction, the newspaper said.

The expanded facility was capable of treating 10,000 cubic metres (354,000 cubic ft) of water an hour, up from 8,000 cubic metres (283,000 cubic ft) previously, the newspaper said, adding that capacity would eventually reach 12,000 cubic metres (424,000 cubic ft) an hour.
The Songhua River has been seriously polluted by waste from factories that have sprung up along its banks since the 1950s, it said.
